snippet: With Apple widely expected to unveil a full-fledged television later this year, Google is determined to reintroduce Google TV, an effort that failed to gain traction when it was introduced in 2010. LG will start rolling out Google TV-enabled telev...
abstract: With Apple widely expected to unveil a full-fledged television later this year, Google is determined to reintroduce Google TV, an effort that failed to gain traction when it was introduced in 2010. LG will start rolling out Google TV-enabled television sets later this month.

headline.main: Google Tries Again With Google TV

snippet: A Luxembourg trade official says the iTunes subsidiary there is not trying to evade taxes.
The use of “Tomorrow Never Knows” in Sunday’s episode of “Mad Men” was a rare instance in which a song written and recorded by the Beatles has been licensed for a television series.
abstract: The use of “Tomorrow Never Knows” in Sunday’s episode of “Mad Men” was a rare instance in which a song written and recorded by the Beatles has been licensed for a television series.

headline.main: How 'Mad Men' Landed the Beatles: All You Need Is Love (and $250,000)
headline.print_headline: A ’60s Show Finally Gets to Play a Song by the Quintessential ’60s Group

byline.original: By DAVE ITZKOFF and BEN SISARIO

snippet: A limited and split decision over copyright violations by Google all but guaranteed continuing litigation.
abstract: Federal District Court jury in San Francisco, in a split decision that all but guarantees continuing litigation, decides that Google infringed on the overall structure of software copyrights held by Oracle, but also says that Google had not violated other important parts of Oracle's software known as Java.

headline.main: U.S. Jury Hands Google Mixed Verdict on Oracle
headline.print_headline: U.S. Jury Hands Google Mixed Verdict on Oracle

byline.original: By QUENTIN HARDY and NICOLE PERLROTH

snippet: What is failure, and what can come from it? In this lesson we post examples from sports, science, business, the arts, politics and education, then pose questions and suggest activities for investigating the notion of "failure" in myriad ways.
abstract: What is failure, and what can come from it? In this lesson we post examples from sports, science, business, the arts, politics and education, then pose questions and suggest activities for investigating the notion of "failure" in myriad ways.

headline.main: Sowing Failure, Reaping Success: What Failure Can Teach

byline.original: By DANIEL E. SLOTNIK and KATHERINE SCHULTEN

snippet: The protesters, who represent all 23 California State University campuses, are refusing all solid food "for at least a week" to protest rising tuition costs.
abstract: The protesters, who represent all 23 California State University campuses, are refusing all solid food "for at least a week" to protest rising tuition costs.

headline.main: California State Students Protest by Fasting

abstract: By late summer, 1,700 conductors will be using the Apple devices to scan tickets electronically and do much more.

snippet: Marijuana growers are shifting to the suburbs from rural and commercial areas, helped by a housing crisis that created a glut of affordable houses for indoor farming.
abstract: Organized marijuana growers are shifting to the suburbs from rural and commercial areas, taking advantage of a glut of spacious, affordable houses for indoor farming; grow houses often go unnoticed by neighbors, and police in areas like California have largely stopped looking for them.

headline.main: Foreclosed Houses Become Homes for Indoor Marijuana Farms
headline.print_headline: Foreclosed Houses Become Homes for Indoor Marijuana Farms
